#text=My yard was very bare and plain-looking so I decided to add some trees to the landscape .
#text=First , I went to the local nursery and asked them for advice on what kinds of trees would do well in my area , level of sunlight , amount of precipitation , etc .
#text=They gave me some ideas and I picked out a Bradford pear tree sapling .
#text=I took it home and left it in shade while I prepared to plant it .
#text=First I got out a shovel and dug a deep enough hole to cover the whole root ball of the tree .
#text=Then I placed some fertilizer in the bottom of the hole .
#text=Next I unwrapped the root ball from the burlap sack which contained it and placed it in the hole that I had dug .
#text=Once it was in , I shoveled the dirt back into the opening and tamped it firmly around the base of the tree .
#text=After that I placed a soaker hose near it to give it plenty of water .
